core_philosophy.feel: Modern, professional, high-fidelity, and energetic. The experience should feel responsive and dimensional. Key features include fluid typography, dual-theme support, and snappy, lifted hover effects.
core_philosophy.dimensionality: Achieved through prominent rounded corners, controlled box-shadows on cards/buttons, and the 'lift' animation on interactive elements. This creates a sense of depth between the content and the background.
core_philosophy.interactivity_and_snappiness: All interactive elements (buttons, links, chips) must use the defined 'snappy' easing curve for quick feedback that slows down dramatically at the end, making the app feel **fast and polished**.
core_philosophy.accessibility_focus: Mandatory adherence to accessibility standards, primarily through high-contrast colors (especially in Dark Mode) and universal `:focus-visible` states.

color_palette.theme_support: Full light and dark mode support is mandatory, driven by CSS variables. Developers must ensure all new colors are also defined for dark mode in `body.dark-mode`.

--card-bg.description: Card/Container background (slightly darker than --bg). Used for content areas within the page.

--ink.description: Primary text/heading color (very dark blue-grey). Used for main body copy, strong headings, and primary button background.

--mute.description: Secondary/Muted text and subtle outline color. Used for body paragraphs, secondary nav items, and subtle borders.

--line.description: Thin borders, dividers, and light slider background. This is the primary separator color.

--accent-color.description: Primary brand color (Vibrant Blue) for text links, focus states, and navigation highlights.

--accent-gradient.description: Blue-to-Cyan gradient used for the H1 headline, card highlights, and other key brand elements.

--line.description: Dark mode border/separator. Must ensure sufficient contrast.

--accent-color.description: White/Light accent for visibility against dark backgrounds.

h1_style.color_application: Mandatory use of `--accent-gradient` via `background-clip: text` and `color: transparent;` for the vibrant, gradient-filled headline effect.

p_style.color_application: Always use `--mute` for body text to maintain clear visual hierarchy and separate body from main headings.

global_container.side_padding: Desktop: 24px; Mobile: 18px on screens < 600px. Always ensure fluid padding for responsiveness.

spacing_scale.section_padding_rule: Sections should use `--space-7` (72px) vertical padding on marketing pages (`<section>` tag). Application surfaces typically use smaller padding like `--space-3` (24px).

--shadow-sm.description: Smallest shadow, used for pill elements and subtle lift.

--shadow-md.description: Standard card shadow (resting state and primary button hover).

--shadow-lg.description: Largest shadow, typically used for prominent elements or card-tile hover state for maximum lift effect.

glassmorphism_rule.application: Sticky Headers (`header`) and certain utility surfaces (`.surface-glass`).
glassmorphism_rule.style: Uses `backdrop-filter: blur(12px);` combined with a semi-transparent background color (e.g., `rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9)` in light mode) to create a frosted glass effect.

easing_function.description: Crucial: This is the custom-defined curve for the core 'snappy' feel. It ensures interactions feel responsive by front-loading the transition speed.

lift_animation_rule.style: On hover/focus, apply vertical translation: `transform: translateY(-2px)` for buttons and `-4px` for cards/pills. This must be coupled with the `--ease-snappy` transition.

scroll_reveal_animation.description: Used to introduce new sections/elements into the viewport. This must be handled by JavaScript adding the `.is-visible` class upon scroll, ensuring elements fade in and slide up gracefully.

viewports.mobile_max: 768px (Primary break for nav and stacked layouts.)
viewports.tablet_max: 900px (Used for specific structural shifts, e.g., hero content alignment.)

general_grid_structure.app_surfaces_rule: Prefer flexible grids (`display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(Xpx, 1fr));`) over fixed column counts for layout flexibility.

mobile_nav_behavior.style: The primary navigation (`.nav-right`) must switch from flex row to **fixed, full-screen overlay** (`position: fixed; width: 100%; height: 100%;`). The toggle button uses the mandatory hamburger/X transform animation for clarity.

style_rules.mobile_toggle_animation: Hamburger lines must transform into an 'X' (`transform: translateY(8px) rotate(45deg);` and `translateY(-8px) rotate(-45deg);`)

style_rules.mobile_rule: On screens below 600px, buttons must adopt `width: 100%;` and `justify-content: center;` to ensure easy tapping/readability.

component_recipes.name: Standard Card / Tile

style_rules.default_state: background: var(--card-bg); border: 1px solid var(--line); box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
style_rules.accent_highlight: Marketing cards (`.card`) implement a 4px accent gradient top border highlight (`::before`) that transitions to full opacity on hover.

component_recipes.feel: Soft-edged, floating container that clearly lifts off the background on interaction.

style_rules.shape: Pill shape (999px border-radius) with generous padding.
style_rules.active_state: When active/current, the background/text shifts to high-contrast (`background: var(--bg); color: var(--ink);`) and the lift effect is applied.

footer_structure.positioning_rule: Uses `margin-top: auto;` to ensure it pushes all content above it, making it stick to the bottom of the viewport on short pages.
footer_structure.separation: A top border separates it from the main content: `border-top: 1px solid var(--line);`
footer_structure.content_layout: Uses a `.footer-inner` flex container to justify links and copyright/brand info between the left and right. Mobile view stacks and centers content (`@media (max-width: 768px)`).
